on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: He was getting through games last season on painkilling injections.
sentences.chinese: 去季他都是在注射止痛剂的情况下坚持上场的。

sentences.english: Walton will continue to split time with Radmanovic.
sentences.chinese: 沃顿将继续和拉德马诺维奇分享上场时间。

sentences.english: The coach substituted Smith for Jones.
sentences.chinese: 教练让史密斯上场，换下了钟斯。

sentences.english: This game is for players who’ve not really played that often.
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛是为那些不经常上场的球员准备的。

sentences.english: Neither have closed-door meetings or trying out rookie hurlers.
sentences.chinese: 开密室会议及派菜鸟投手上场也没有扭转颓势。

sentences.english: Only the two back-up goalkeepers and central defender Raul Albiol did not get playing time.
sentences.chinese: 只有2个替补守门员和中卫阿尔比奥尔没上场。

sentences.english: This will give the opportunity for Chase Budinger to play more and get more experience.
sentences.chinese: 我的缺阵将让巴丁格获得更多的上场时间和比赛经验。

sentences.english: South Gaitt hoped that he can continue to go on stage to the Uygur post marvelous show.
sentences.chinese: 索斯盖特希望他能继续上场对维冈的精彩表演。
什么时候第一次上场检验？

sentences.english: I feel my pression because I want to win every match every time when I go to the court.
sentences.chinese: 我有压力因为每次上场时我想赢得每场比赛。

sentences.english: The cheer of the fan echo round the grind as the team appear.
sentences.chinese: 球队刚一上场，球迷的欢呼声立即响遍全场。

sentences.english: Professional model is, of course, but many programs do not have the time I play.
sentences.chinese: 固然是职业模特，但是很多节目都没有我上场的时机。

sentences.english: Will Suarez be playing in flippers and snorkel.
sentences.chinese: 苏亚雷斯会不会戴着脚蹼和通气管上场踢球？

sentences.english: Dayton was substituted for Williams in the second half of the match.
sentences.chinese: 下半场比赛由戴顿代替威廉上场。

sentences.english: But the rope-dancer, who thought the words applied to him, began his performance.
sentences.chinese: 而走钢索者以为这些话是要他上场，便开始献技。

sentences.english: I had to get players in quickly just to get a team on the pitch.
sentences.chinese: 我必须很快的找到几个人好凑够人数上场比赛。

definition: (of a performer) to come onto the stage to perform/(of an athlete) to enter the arena to compete/(fig.) to enter the scene (e.g. a new product)/(of an examinee etc) to leave the venue
competition (sports etc)/match/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]/to compete
to go on stage/fig. to appear on the scene/used in advertising to mean new product
to compete/to take part (in a sports event)
to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
to come back out of retirement/to get involved again after having withdrawn
poised for battle/to square up for a fight
stadium/playing field for a competition
sports team (basketball, soccer, football etc)
to be present/to be on the scene
first issue/first public showing
racetrack/field (for athletics competition)
armistice
opponent/rival/competitor/(well-matched) adversary/match
team member
